title.narrative: Strengthening Cross-Sectoral Collaboration for Social Cohesion (SC3) project

description.narrative: CSOs, networks and activists at community and oblast level across Ukraine, especially those working with young and/or disadvantaged people Decision-makers and representatives of local government.

The Strengthening Cross-Sectoral Collaboration for Social Cohesion (SC3) project is a 36-month project aimed at effectively addressing development challenges and opportunities at local level through improved cooperation between civil society organisations (CSOs) and local authorities (LAs) in Ukraine. It is funded by EU and the British Council and delivered by the British Council working with three experienced (CSO) co-beneficiaries, and will operate across all of the Government-controlled areas (GCA) of Ukraine, including GCA Donetsk and Luhansk.

The overall objective of the project is to address local development challenges and opportunities more effectively and innovatively through joint and mutually reinforcing initiatives of local authorities and CSOs, leading to greater social cohesion at community level. The two specific objectives are: 1. For CSOs based in and working with local communities across Ukraine to enhance their influence and cooperation with state bodies, for greater effectiveness and sustainability. 2. The action intends that LAs engage more innovatively and productively with communities in addressing local development issues, thereby improving trust and understanding between communities and local government.
The project includes the following activities: 1. Capacity development activities 2. Seed-funding of social action projects

name.narrative: There are three administrative areas in Ukraine for the project, which are chosen for the National partners to work with: 1) Western Ukraine with the hub in Lutsk. The area covers the following oblasts:Volyn, Lviv, Rivne, Zhytomyr, Ternopil, Chenivtsi, Ivano-Frankivsk, Zakarpatia. 2) Northern and Eastern Ukraine with the hub in Kyiv. The area covers the following oblasts: Government-controlled areas (GCA) of Donetsk, GCA of Luhansk, Zaporizhzhia, Kharkiv, Kyiv, Sumy, Chernihiv, Poltava. 3) Southern and Central Ukraine with th hub in Kherson. The area covers the following oblasts: Kherson, Mykolayiv, Odesa, Vinnytsia, Kirovohrad, Cherkasy, Dnipro, Khmelnytskyi.
